<title level="1" right="Action">[Explode](/Actions.aspx?ID=902) <actions string="Two Actions" /></title>

<traits>
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Inventor" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=408" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Unstable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=416" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 19</row>

</column>

---

You intentionally take your [innovation](/classes/inventor/innovations) beyond normal safety limits, making it explode and damage nearby creatures without damaging the innovation... hopefully. The explosion deals 2d6 fire damage with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save to all creatures in a 5-foot emanation around you (if you're wearing or holding the innovation) or around your innovation (if your innovation is a [minion](/Traits.aspx?ID=109)).

 At 3rd level, and every level thereafter, increase your explosion's damage by 1d6.

 If you have the breakthrough innovation class feature, you can choose either a 5-foot or 10-foot emanation for the area when you use Explode; if you have the revolutionary innovation class feature, you can choose a 5-foot, 10-foot, or 15-foot emanation.
name: Explode
